init_parameter

Created on Tue Dec 3 10:45:01 2019

@author: F. Bauget

Parameters class:
init

set the default values

Methods

  • read_file: read the Yaml configuration file containing the model parameters into a Class.

  • init_calculation: perform some initialization

  • parameters_to_list: convert some parameters to list if they are not

class hydroroot.init_parameter.Parameters[source]

Bases: object

Init Parameters class. Set setting default values and structure

Parameters

  • archi – all inputs related to the architecture generation or reconstruction

  • read_architecture – Bool

  • input_dir – string

  • input_file – list of string

  • seed – integer or list of integer

  • length_file – list of strings

  • length_data – float data containing in the files above

  • primary_length – float or list of float

  • branching_delay – float or list of float

  • branching_variability – float

  • order_max – integer

  • segment_length – float

  • nude_length – float or list of float

  • ref_radius – float

  • order_decrease_factor – float

  • hydro – inputs related to the hydrodynamics

  • k0 – float

  • axial_conductance_data – list of 2 list of float

  • solute – inputs related to solutes transport eather permating or not

  • J_s – float

  • P_s – float

  • Cse – float

  • Ce – float

  • sigma – float

  • exp – inputs related to the experimental conditions and measurements

  • jv – float

  • psi_e – float

  • psi_base – float

  • output – inputs related to the simulations and its output

  • radfold – float or list of float

  • axfold – float or list of float

  • intercepts – list of float

  • run_nb – int

init_calculation()[source]

Set self.archi[‘length_data’] by reading the two files self.archi[‘length_file’] Set the seed to None if seed is not an integer nor a list of integer

Returns

itself

parameters_to_list(parameter)[source]

transform parameter to a list

Parameters

  • parameter – the parameter to transform to a list

  • return –

  • parameter – list

  • In – the yaml file it is possible to use the following syntaxe

  • this – syntax and the corresponding list is calculated

  • to – a list of one single element

  • For – example

  • range –

  • 0 – 02 is converted to

  • see – func

read_file(filename=None)[source]

Read the input yaml file, set the class variables and perform some initialization see init_calculation()

Parameters

  • filename – string (Default value = None)

  • return – itself

  • Some – instance variables are converted to list if not they are not list in the yaml file

  • branching_delay – nude_length
